title: Why do people get so anxious about math? - Orly Rubinsten

multiple-choice.question: What is math anxiety?

options.label: A
options.text: A feeling of excitement and enthusiasm when taking a math test.

options.label: B
options.text: A condition where a person feels anxious or stressed when faced with math problems.

options.label: C
options.text: A condition where a person is unable to solve math problems.

options.label: D
options.text: A condition where a person is bored with math.

multiple-choice.question: What percentage of the population suffers from math anxiety?
What is working memory, and how is it affected by math anxiety?

options.label: A
options.text: Working memory is the long-term memory system that helps you organize information. Math anxiety decreases working memory.

options.label: B
options.text: Working memory is the short-term memory system that helps you organize information. Math anxiety increases working memory.

options.label: C
options.text: Working memory is the long-term memory system that helps you organize information. Math anxiety has no effect on working memory.

options.label: D
options.text: Working memory is the short-term memory system that helps you organize information. Math anxiety decreases working memory.

multiple-choice.question: Why do people with math anxiety struggle with even basic math skills?

options.label: A
options.text: Because they are not paying attention in class.

options.label: B
options.text: Because they are not practicing enough.

options.label: C
options.text: Because they are worried about being able to solve math problems, which eats up working memory.

options.label: D
options.text: Because they are bored with math.

multiple-choice.question: What can people do to overcome math anxiety?

options.label: A
options.text: Relaxation techniques, such as short breathing exercises, can improve test performance.

options.label: B
options.text: Writing down worries can help reevaluate stressful experiences and free up working memory.

options.label: C
options.text: Physical activity, such as a brisk walk, can deepen breathing and relieve muscle tension.

multiple-choice.question: What is a growth mindset, and how can it help people overcome math anxiety?

options.label: A
options.text: A growth mindset is a psychological principle that the brain is fixed and cannot grow or develop. It can help people overcome math anxiety by thinking that they are not good at math.

options.label: B
options.text: A growth mindset is a psychological principle that the brain is flexible and can always grow and develop. It can help people overcome math anxiety by thinking that they can improve and grow.

options.label: C
options.text: A growth mindset is a psychological principle that the brain is a mystery and cannot be understood. It can help people overcome math anxiety by thinking that math is a mystery.

options.label: D
options.text: A growth mindset is a psychological principle that the brain is a muscle that can be strengthened. It can help people overcome math anxiety by thinking that math is a muscle.

options.label: C
